reviewText:
Hi All, Here's the info for this Mac Computer Help Instructional DVD:

#4 in the 'Macs for the Computer Shy' series (updated for Leopard)

In this Mac computer help video, we cover the Leopard (Mac OS 10.5) versions iTunes, iPhoto, iCal, and the Apple Address Book.

NOTE: This instructional video can be watched on Televisions with DVD players and on computers which have DVD Drives.

FREE DVD UPDATES

This Mac computer help video never gets out of date! Free updates to this DVD will be available at [...]

PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS

- How to Burn Music CDs

- How to download and import music into your Mac

- How to import photos from your digital camera into your Mac computer

- How to edit, adjust, enhance, and crop your digital photos

- How to schedule appointments and events on your Mac and set "alarms" for them so you don't forget.

- How to add contacts to your Apple Address Book

- How to print shipping and mailing labels from the Address Book program

ADDITIONAL MAC COMPUTER HELP DVDs

The first instructional DVD in this series is called: 'Okay, I Bought a Mac! Now What?'. The second DVD in this series is called 'Mac Computer Applications.' The third Mac computer help video is 'Mac Computer Applications'. All three are available from Amazon.com and CreateSpace.com.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Help for the Computer Shy founder Michael Gorzka has been teaching 'computer shy' adults how to use personal computers (both Macs & PCs) and various software & Internet applications since 1997. He has incorporated what he has learned from his teaching experiences into his computer help DVDs and manuals."
